title: How to extract a club set from an arbitrary unbounded set (set theory, infinitary combinatorics, math) - Quora

response.answer_text: In general, you don't. Consider the set of all successor ordinals of ω1ω1 (in fact, any limit ordinal with uncountable cofinality would be good as well). Such set is unbounded, but any unbounded subset of it is not closed (it surely misses, to start with, the limit of their first ωω elements, canonically indexed by the order type of the subset).
